text:
It really does feel like the LibDems are about to get into bed with the Tories *again*. Selling out #finalsay #PeoplesVote just as we‚Äôre about to get a majority for one.  #BrexitShambles Quote TweetLloyd Russell-Moyle MP@lloyd_rm ¬∑ Oct 28, 2019In the corridor to a LibDem "why you playing Boris' game, we'er close to securing a People Vote next week"
LD "nobody wants PV now"
Me: "You mean LibDems don't want to stop Brexit with PV"
LD "no to PV"
LimpDems: will sell out everything they hold dear to get in bed with Tories
Replying to @BenPBradshaw The 19 Labour rebels have changed their minds?
Replying to @BenPBradshaw You're repeating an obvious untruth there, Ben.
Which bit?
I simply don't believe that story. 'You don't know my Lib Dem, they go to a different school'. Like I believe they said 'no to PV'.

Replying to @BenPBradshaw Ben, that's nonsense and you know it. @LibDems have tabled a #PeoplesVote multiple times and dithering and indecision is handing a #crashout Brexit to Johnson in January. Actions spk louder, sign the #EDM & encourage all Lab MPs to do the same #GetBrexitGone

Replying to @BenPBradshaw Oh please Ben.  The majority of the people want a peoples vote but Parliament is nowhere near approving it!  Your useless leader has been missing in action on everything Brexit for a year & despite always calling for a GE, is now running scared.
Then you should ask @lloyd_rm who reported it.

Replying to @BenPBradshaw Ben, you are better than this. @joswinson @LibDems tabled their 18th People‚Äôs Vote amendment yesterday! The fact that I know this and you don‚Äôt is astonishing. Now off you go and give Jo the support she and we need.
Your party‚Äôs fence sitting on Brexit will be your undoing at the ballot box
Replying to @BenPBradshaw Oh Ben, this is some serious bunker mentality, hoping that a catastrophic  error of judgement by Jo Swinson will come to Labour's rescue
@joswinson @LibDems tabled their 18th People‚Äôs Vote amendment yesterday. I‚Äôm sure Ben will now contact Jo to give her his full support.

I'm very saddened by @BenPBradshaw now.
I really thought he was different. But when the chips are down, Labour revert to type.
Replying to @BenPBradshaw I thought you were one of the sensible ones.

Replying to @BenPBradshaw Utterly misleading, Ben. And what‚Äôs worse is you absolutely know it. Come up with a workable alternative or face the complete anger of Remainers who have been fighting for 4 years!
That story just doesn't pass the smell test.
Yup
Replying to @BenPBradshaw Labour have done EVERYTHING to ensure that  ref2 doesn't happen. Ive  given up on labour.

Replying to @BenPBradshaw Respect you greatly, but given your colleagues Onn, Nandy, Snell etc they would pass the deal. Quote TweetJo Maugham@JolyonMaugham ¬∑ Oct 28, 2019Note, only one source. But the suggestion is that without the Lib Dem/SNP initiative for a General Election we would likely have been leaving with No Deal or Boris Johnson's Hard Brexit in mid November. twitter.com/JenniferMerode‚Ä¶

Replying to @BenPBradshaw Look, LDs would understand that the tribal gene kicks in this close to an election, but this sort of nervous lashing out is really beneath someone as normally pragmatic as you. Do you really think it convinces anyone? Disappointing.

Replying to @BenPBradshaw Sorry but Labour MP's need to act now. 

You are the official opposition: What do you want?

GE or #PeoplesVote ?

LibDem's and SNP need you and extension is only 3 months. How you gonna use it?

Don't blame LibDem, SNP etc if they are trying to find different routes.

Replying to @BenPBradshaw 1) there is no evidence that you‚Äôre about to get a PV majority; much as I would like it
2) labour has refused to sanction mp‚Äôs for defying whip on PV
3) JC doesn‚Äôt turn up to PV rallies.
4) there are enough Flints in Labour to crap themselves and vote for the WAB.

Replying to @BenPBradshaw LISTEN. Another PV motion has been tabled for vote today. 

I‚Äôve lost count of the number of times labour has refused to vote for it, must be in the teens by now.

LAST CHANCE. Either support it or support Brexit. Your choice.

Replying to @BenPBradshaw It took #PeoplesVote about 2 years to get Corbyn sort-of on board. 

Not that long ago it was all "a lib dem / blairite trick to make Jeremy look bad".

When, precisely, can we expect this "about to happen" majority to materialise, Ben?
Replying to @BenPBradshaw I knew it. I had a bad feeling about Jo Swinson

The bickering has to stop.

Just support this everyone
Replying to @BenPBradshaw Feelings and reality, don‚Äôt go well together
Replying to @BenPBradshaw It's a GE or Boris' Brexit deal, delivered by Labour votes.

Replying to @BenPBradshaw We would be out on our arse if it weren't for LibDem/SNP right now: 
When is *the Labour Leadership* going to vote *for* a referendum Ben? When are they going to have words with the Flints? 
Sick of SNP/Lab/LD/G scrapping. Work together for God's sake Quote TweetJennifer Rankin@JenniferMerode ¬∑ Oct 28, 2019So after Friday‚Äôs fuss, EU ambassadors took only 15/20 minutes to rubber stamp the Brexit ‚Äúflextension‚Äù. LibDem-SNP election decision described as a ‚Äúgame changer‚Äù for Emmanuel Macron by one EU diplomat.
Replying to @BenPBradshaw Where‚Äôs the majority?  I‚Äôd live there to be one but Labour won‚Äôt three line whip support one. Possibly because your leadership backs Brexit.
Replying to @BenPBradshaw Is the option 'to stay' in your peoples vote thinking? Please clarify
Replying to @BenPBradshaw Must admit I just don't get it. Brexit just got even weirder.

Replying to @BenPBradshaw If you‚Äôre honest Labour aren‚Äôt close to securing a people‚Äôs vote though are they? Lib Dem‚Äôs if elected would revoke article 50 but they still support a people‚Äôs vote as a means towards remain however we‚Äôre running out of time for that to happen.
Replying to @BenPBradshaw I agree that an election is in their favour as it is in the SNP‚Äôs favour. It‚Äôs not in Labour‚Äôs favour which is why the party don‚Äôt want one.

People‚Äôs vote is something that the Lib Dem‚Äôs supported and called for long before Labour. In fact they were lambasted for asking for a second referendum at the time. Labour refused to commit to a decisive position and are now paying the price.

Replying to @BenPBradshaw labour needs to attack Brexit stop playing games..  
labour is the only party stopping another referendum
What Ben is saying simply isn‚Äôt true though and he knows it.
She is trying to get support for. PV right now. Labour not moving.

All I'm saying Labour is holding all the cards and to be truthful I have little faith to those Labour MP's who wants Brexit.

LidDem's have bee with remainers 3, 5 years: I think it's now your turn to do something.

I admire you Ben but LibDem's aren't the problem here.
Replying to @BenPBradshaw Didn‚Äôt happen.  If it had happened, the Lib Dem would have been named.

Replying to @BenPBradshaw For goodness sake Ben, I thought better of you! Corbyn is still saying he‚Äôll only support a PV on a new deal negotiated by Labour. How will that happen without a GE? When has Labour wholeheartedly supported a PV? Why should we believe things will change?

Replying to @BenPBradshaw And Corbyn has enabled #Brexit right rom the start by voting for A50. He has then voted with the Tories or abstained to stop every attempt to get a #PV. Corbyn and Swinson now as bad as each other. Get together and act with commonsense and STOP sniping at each other.

Replying to @BenPBradshaw It really feels like the Labour Party are determined to deliver Brexit above all else. They have sold out all the people they claim to represent. 17 times they have opposed a #PeoplesVote . If you want a war with the Lib Dems Ben, we will give as good as we get.

Replying to @BenPBradshaw Disgusted with all of you. Don‚Äôt pretend that @UKLabour‚Äôs ‚Äúlong game‚Äù would have saved us. Corbyn has never supported PV. If he had, Brexit could have been stopped any time since 2017 & you‚Äôd have been in power. At every turn, he‚Äôs facilitated it, regardless of members & public.

Replying to @BenPBradshaw Absolute rubbish.  Labour MPs showing their true colours with stupid, loaded tweets like this.  Everyone knows we wouldn‚Äôt be in this mess if you lot had had the courage to remove Corbyn and / or removed the whip from the Labour-Tory 19 and had supported the other 17 PV attempts.

Replying to @BenPBradshaw Come on .@BenPBradshaw LibDems have consistently tried to get a PV through.  Without Labour‚Äôs support the attempts failed.

Labour failed to support .@joannaccherry attempts.

Neither SNP nor LibDems are trying to prop up Tories just to #StopBrexit
Replying to @BenPBradshaw Oh please! Stop lying
Replying to @BenPBradshaw Mate your party is an obstacle to a PV.
Replying to @BenPBradshaw People's vote like voting for a dodo
Replying to @BenPBradshaw If this meeting was true, let him name the MP

Replying to @BenPBradshaw Jo Swinson tabled her 18th People‚Äôs Vote amendment yesterday Ben. Please put your energies into persuading your colleagues to support her instead of attacking fellow Remainers.
Replying to @BenPBradshaw Shame to see this from a respectable MP
Replying to @BenPBradshaw Cannot trust a Fibdem
Replying to @BenPBradshaw Labour = Cowards
Replying to @BenPBradshaw This is below you, Ben.
Replying to @BenPBradshaw You are better than this, Ben.
Replying to @BenPBradshaw What else were they gonna go? How else did Swinson draw all the ejected Tories?
Replying to @BenPBradshaw A bit rich coming from your shambolic  party under it‚Äôs shambolic leader

Replying to @BenPBradshaw I don't see it. They would halve their membership in a heartbeat, and be usurped by a Labour split centre left party.

What it really does feel like is that @UKLabour are panicking with a GE coming up that few of their MP's want. And so targeting the direct competition for votes.
Replying to @BenPBradshaw and @esme_hornbeam Labour leadership has frustrated all previous PV attempts, most recently by lack of party discipline by Brexiteer Corbyn.

Replying to @BenPBradshaw 17 times, the LibDem have tabled amendments for #PeoplesVote. 17 times Labour refused to support it.

Who's supporting Tories here?

Replying to @BenPBradshaw I don‚Äôt feel that ben. I feel that labour has let me down by failing to support or lead on a peoples vote. I feel that the Lib Dem‚Äôs are trying to change the numbers in parliament to get a people‚Äôs vote which is better than sitting on hands
Replying to @BenPBradshaw You weren't "about to get a majority" for one

Replying to @BenPBradshaw Comments like that are just another reason - on top of the ghastly & useless caveman Corbyn - why after 51 years of being Labour I am now #NoLongerLabour #GetRidOfCorbyn #StopBrexit or be prepared for political annihilation #LabourToOblivion
Replying to @BenPBradshaw So get behind the LibDems motion for #PeoplesVote and sort out the front bench to get behind this too.  Now.

Replying to @BenPBradshaw Ben, please be reasonable, thanks to Johnson chicanery since taking office there isn‚Äôt enough time for a PV - look how long EU Ref legislation took https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/European_Union_Referendum_Act_2015‚Ä¶ PPERA = 24wks @joswinson has played only strategic option left to #StopBrexit
Replying to @BenPBradshaw This is NOT the time for cheap political shots, it's the time to focus on getting rid of this disgusting 'government'.
Replying to @BenPBradshaw Make them an offer then.

Replying to @BenPBradshaw Are you serious? You are a blooming disgrace, and I used to have great respect for you. @LibDems have been totally consistent in stopping #Brexit, @UKLabour have consistently let remainers down.
Get rid of Corbyn and overnight your election prospects will change.He's the wrong man to lead,I don't care how good his heart is or how long his membership of the LP, he will lose big time in a GE.

Replying to @BenPBradshaw Ben, why don‚Äôt you sign the EDM laid down by Jo Swinson yesterday.  If enough sign, and prove there‚Äôs a majority for a PV, then great. If not I‚Äôm afraid your Dear Leader has let us all down & put us in the position where the gamble of a GE is only option left in the time we have.
your loyalty is admirable but Swinson is plainly on the Coalition 2.1 Trail and the Ministerial Car. Which fits her Tory convictions to a tee.

Replying to @BenPBradshaw It feels like, at the vital moment when we need the opposition parties to pull together, they're all going against each other. They all need to keep communicating or the Conservatives and Leave will win.

Replying to @BenPBradshaw This is shameful.

I asked for the spreadsheet to show where that majority was that nobody else has been able to discern.

Provide it.

Test out the votes with indicative votes on the EDM.

Meanwhile Quote TweetLibDemTim@libdemtim ¬∑ Oct 27, 2019Corbyn: I want an election not PV
Johnson: I want an election
Corbyn: You can‚Äôt have it. 
LibDems: We want a PV now!
Corbyn: No
Johnson: No
LibDems: (reluctantly) Lets have an election then...
Corbyn: No
Johnson: No
LibDems: 
The #LibDems want to #StopBrexit twitter.com/EdwardJDavey/s‚Ä¶
Replying to @BenPBradshaw Are you signing the EDM calling for a PV?
Replying to @BenPBradshaw Hardly... you say you want a GE but don‚Äôt vote for one! You are literally keeping Johnson in power
Replying to @BenPBradshaw I can't see any signs of Labour actually supporting one any time soon - always jam tomorrow as Labour's line on a 2nd ref has been for ages now...

Another futile gesture. The numbers were always only going to be there & will be there for a #FinalSay #PeoplesVote when it‚Äôs the last man standing. Gifting Johnson/Cummings the December election they crave destroys that prospect.

Replying to @BenPBradshaw Also I‚Äôve just seen video of @joswinson in HoC asking for MPs to sign her @peoplesvote_uk motion 28th Oct. if that‚Äôs the case why didn‚Äôt all Labour MPs rush in to sign it???

I understand the frustration with Labour‚Äôs approach to Brexit. But am similarly mystified as to why the Lib Dems are going to hand vile Johnson and his #NastyParty a 5 year majority government to destroy the UK totally. LibDems may do relatively well but short term gain etc??

Replying to @BenPBradshaw No I don't think so Ben. Look forward first of all.

The SNP/LibDem motion is brilliant. 25 days are needed in law for an election. It stops Johnson not only putting through his WA, but also his deal again. 

They are both anti brexit, they have not changed their minds....

Replying to @BenPBradshaw Dear me old Seumas has even got to you. You and the party must be cacking it.

Let's us remind you that the LDs have tabled amendments for a PV 18 times including last week.

Corbyn has not once said he backs remain let alone attended a PV rally.

I rarely comment directly on parliamentary stuff as such ..  but, does this sound as pathetic to you / others as it does to me?

I truly thought maybe the LibDems have got it now; but No?

PUSH for #PeoplesVote and more enfranchisement before GE.

It‚Äôs the only #Democratic way
Replying to @BenPBradshaw Is your name on the EDM, then? https://edm.parliament.uk/early-day-motion/53420/peoples-vote‚Ä¶

Replying to @BenPBradshaw I agree - they‚Äôve broken a fundamental principle of collectivism - unity - is solidarity - is power @johnmcdonnellMP @jeremycorbyn @ChukaUmunna @joswinson it‚Äôs quite an awful betrayal of us all

But in which parallel universe will the Lib Dems win a majority with the #NastyParty at 40% in the Polls? I simply cannot understand why any non #Tory party would hand the vile oaf a 5 year term in office? Better to make them squirm in the mess of their #ToryBrexit ad nauseum!

PS can you explain why (despite my pleas) LibDems won‚Äôt even push for clarity and truth re what‚Äôs happened?

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/241848‚Ä¶

You want another GE before we even admit there were errors in #EURef which need 
a proper #PublicInquiry to be set up?

Not even plans for that? Petition: Halt Brexit For A Public InquiryThe UK's departure from the EU looms but questions remain about the legitimacy of the Referendum. The Electoral Commission said illegal overspending occurred during the Referendum. Were the vote/any...petition.parliament.uk
Replying to @BenPBradshaw Keep me briefed. That alliance seems very unlikely, but if so, I'll resist it.
I‚Äôm more interested in sensible & practicable ways of achieving a #FinalSay #PeoplesVote & stopping #Brexit

Replying to @BenPBradshaw Ben, remind me... how did Labour vote the last 17 times the LibDems moved a vote for a PV in parliament?

How would LibDems vote tomorrow if PV on offer?

Some Labour MPs may have supported PV, but not all, and your leadership has been missing in action throughout!

Replying to @BenPBradshaw Absolutely shocking Ben. I and I'd guess most remainers thought better of you than this.

How about you get into bed with LibDems first and support the motion for a PV?

You are now letting the entire country down.
Replying to @BenPBradshaw Seems to me that any Election needs to wait for election law reform. Otherwise we won't get what this country needs.
Replying to @BenPBradshaw We all know that‚Äôs codswallop, Ben. Depressing to see you parroting the party line without filter.
The game changed when Johnson got a deal & 19 Labour MPs voted for it at 2nd reading giving a majority of 30. It shows the numbers are there to get his WAB back.

Replying to @BenPBradshaw It really does feel like Labour are going to get into bed with the Tories, etc.
https://twitter.com/lewis_goodall/status/1189122143516270592?s=19‚Ä¶ This Tweet is unavailable.

Replying to @BenPBradshaw  Quote TweetChantelle@ChantelleSeddon ¬∑ Oct 29, 2019Yesterday, any who follow me will see, I preached for some civility between the opposition benches.

I am so angry and heartbroken today. Yesterday we fought to deny 3 days extra to Johnson for GE he needs so he can freeze out student vote or attempt to bring back WAB.

1/8Show this thread
Replying to @BenPBradshaw I thought you were better than this silly propaganda. But, clearly, you aren't.

Replying to @BenPBradshaw Swinson is a Tory!!. She was speaking at the peoples vote march. And now, just like Johnson, she's changed her mind. If a peoples vote was to go ahead that would end her dreams of power. She has lied to us all.

Replying to @BenPBradshaw Really disappointed to see another MP I respect parroting such rubbish. Your party's been calling for an election for two years, Ben. SNP and Lib Dems recognise that the timeline is tight now if we want to avoid a 31 Jan No Deal. Your leader won't whip for a People's Vote, so

Replying to @BenPBradshaw I mean it has taken Labour over three years to get behind a People's Vote! During those years Labour facilitated a Tory #Brexit and is still proposing #Lexit.  Let's face it,  Remainers are at the moment having to hold their noses when thinking about voting
Agree David. This is similar to @johnmcdonnellMP 's misinformation tweet yesterday.

Replying to @BenPBradshaw As a lifelong Labour supporter until recently, your post disappoints me. I left as Corbyn has let me down. Don't do the same. You should be working with all other MPs to deliver a #PeoplesVote or #GE to try and save us all, save businesses, #EUcitizens and jobs, not this.
Replying to @BenPBradshaw Utter deflection from yet another labour MP who would rather watch his own leadership dither us into a no-deal Brexit than actually stand for something.

Replying to @BenPBradshaw It doesn't feel like the Lib Dems are getting into bed with the Tories. It feels like, recognising that 20-30 Labour MPs are set against a #PeoplesVote, they have concluded that the only way to #DitchBrexit is to go for an election. Remainers should stop sniping at each other.

Replying to @BenPBradshaw Labour MPs are first and foremost Labour members.

Remainer and Leaver are badges of convenience worn as appropriate.

Labour members are first and foremost Labour members. They are the foundations on which Labour‚Äôs hypocrisy stands. You can‚Äôt trust Labour. I‚Äôm sick of them.
Lib Dem‚Äôs have tabled a motion for a PV 17 times. I would hazard a guess they will try again. This time Labour might bother supporting.

Replying to @BenPBradshaw Many agree with you. Seems the LD have not learned from their disastrous ‚Äòcoalition‚Äô last time. Johnson/Cummings cannot be trusted and yet they are going to trust him; unbelievable.

username: Colin -May the odds be ever in your favour.
text: Replying to @BenPBradshaw For the past 3 years the behaviour of the labour party has been infuriating. This has not improved my perception.
Replying to @BenPBradshaw Labour MPs are worried about losing there job ... if people want a people‚Äôs vote they would vote labour anyway wouldn‚Äôt they ??

Replying to @BenPBradshaw #Labour need to get their own house in order (your 19 rebels) before trying to create a lame narrative that the 19 #LibDem MPs are propping up  a Borris #Brexit. If you are throwing mud you must have conceded defeat. #LibDem still fighting on @SWYforEurope @LibDems
Replying to @BenPBradshaw and @mtpennycook Except for the fact that this story is totally made up...
How can labour MPs who are in leave constituencies vote for a people vote ?? What is that saying to the people they are suppose to represent ?
Replying to @BenPBradshaw and @Decdently_sweet Wouldn't everybody be shocked if the LibDems didn't sell out?  They're a kind of Integrity-of-Convenience outfit.
Replying to @BenPBradshaw Hi Ben. The Libdems have put a people‚Äôs vote to parliament 17 times. It has never received the votes.

We‚Äôre fed up waiting interminably for Corbyn to back a #PeoplesVote while loads of Labour MPs vote with Boris Johnson. Red Tory/ Blue Labour? Who cares! We need an election! 

#StopBrexit #VoteLibDem #LibDem
Replying to @BenPBradshaw You all have yet another chance to vote for one coming up. So please do just that. #DitchBrexit

Replying to @BenPBradshaw If someone said no to you 17 times, what makes you think they'd change their mind on the 18th? Not necessarily you Ben, but the Labour Party have let every people's vote amendment tabled by the Lib Dems die. We have to try something new.
Replying to @BenPBradshaw Not even close. Just work together to stop Brexit.
Makes you wonder why she didn't just join the Tory party and save herself a lot of trouble #sarcasm

Replying to @BenPBradshaw Did you support the 7 votes @LibDems secured in the house or have you signed @joswinson EDM #72 calling for a people‚Äôs vote. @UKLabour have some who support a 2nd referendum but until fence sitter Corbyn makes the right decision there is not enough support for a PV.

Replying to @BenPBradshaw Cut the tribalism, I have my doubts about the current course of action but if your party got of its backside and voted for a #PeoplesVote we wouldn't be in this position. Libdems do not have to prove their position on a PV

Replying to @BenPBradshaw Labour got into bed with the Tories to trigger A50, just because you hoped it would stitch them up. You set us on this course and stitched the country up.

We now have no choice, and that is on Labour, and only Labour. Get your own house in order. Quote TweetBobby Dean@Bobby_Dean ¬∑ Oct 28, 2019Lib Dems have tabled 17 motions calling for a Peoples Vote and Labour told us they want an election first. 

Now the Lib Dems move to an election, Labour want a Peoples Vote first. 

I‚Äôd find it funny if I didn‚Äôt think it‚Äôs deliberately dishonest.
Replying to @BenPBradshaw From where I stand labour are in bed with the tories. #labourtorypact

I‚Äôm not suggesting that Lib Dems will Wim a GE, merely stating that revoking article 50 is their position should they get in. They are open to PV but mindful of the fact that cross party consensus is unlikely in the timespan we now have.
Replying to @BenPBradshaw and @DPJHodges Dreamer.
You're right....we need to focus on stopping Brexit and defeating the Tories. People need to stop blaming @LibDems for doing their best to do just this in difficult circumstances.

Corbyn can give MPs and Seumas both what they want by amending the one-line bill to include a PV on the same day as a GE. The 1975 referendum was conducted within 4 weeks of the Act, so there is time for a ref.

Replying to @BenPBradshaw There is no majority for a PV. Going for an election would hopefully change the makeup in Parliament is the favour of one. Why is Labour so against one now when it has been calling for one for years?? Because you want to back Boris‚Äôs deal...?

Replying to @BenPBradshaw It's academic now that Lab's decided for an election, but last week some Labour MPs voted with govt and gave every impression of wanting Johnson's deal to pass. And your leader kaiboshed PV.
Replying to @BenPBradshaw and @DPJHodges 3 hours later and it looks like the entire Labour leadership is getting in bed with the Tories, selling out PV...
Yes. There are plenty of peoples vote options.
Replying to @BenPBradshaw and @DPJHodges Did you bring a spare pillow for yourself?

Surely, priority right now must be keeping the Tories squirming in the mess they created...THEN  a GE when people can see truth. Handing them 5 yrs in power now = disaster. Policies by any non-Tory party admirable as they may be are irrelevant when we get Johnson till 2024!
Replying to @BenPBradshaw Hopping in with them too now it seems.
Replying to @BenPBradshaw Seems like Labour are jumping in the same bed. December election now has Corbyn‚Äôs backing.
Replying to @BenPBradshaw We have to face reality. No PV without Govt support. So let's change the Govt.
Replying to @BenPBradshaw and @DPJHodges All the opposition have to do is agree to a #peoplesvote The @LibDems have been seeking consensus on this for years
Oh look! Labour fancy one after all! I can‚Äôt keep up!

Replying to @BenPBradshaw Labour's policy has been to support Brexit by obstructing any effort to stop it. Youe rejected the LibDem proposals for a People's Vote 17 times already. Seventeen. And 19 Labour MPs voted with the Tories to push a hard Brexit over the line, with absolutely no consequences.

Replying to @BenPBradshaw Bollocks. Labour have had over three years to get behind a second vote, still won't do it and Corbyn didn't show at any of the marches.

Not only that, the party's taken no action whatsoever against its MPs when they break the whip to support the Tories. Tell me that's not a wink

Replying to @BenPBradshaw "This afternoon I've again tabled a motion calling for a PV. So if parliament wants to show me the numbers are there, then sign it"
#Brexit https://twitter.com/Doozy_45/status/1188881513695318020/video/1‚Ä¶
Replying to @BenPBradshaw and @mtpennycook So you are voting No against your party whip today?
Replying to @BenPBradshaw Just as you were getting a majority for one ,? No just as you were about to facilitate the toxic deal you mean ?

This shows Jo's frustration

"This afternoon I've again tabled a motion calling for a PV. So if parliament wants to show me the numbers are there, then sign it"
#Brexit https://twitter.com/Doozy_45/status/1188881513695318020/video/1‚Ä¶
Replying to @BenPBradshaw It feels more like one of the few politicians I had respect for is playing a blame game and putting party interests before the countries. A terrible shame.

Replying to @BenPBradshaw Oh wait - Labour gets into bed with Tories to back a GE.  Cant and hypocrisy from Labour.  

If we get a Johnson majority it will because of Labour who have been on a total retro politics nostalgia trip with old school Marxists for the last 4 years.

Exactly! If Labour are concerned about their 'leave' supporters then a PV would have given them a new and clear mandate. What they haven't done is given people a chance to say whether they've changed their minds or not. Wasn't this their policy after all?
Replying to @BenPBradshaw and @DPJHodges So is Labour ....
Replying to @BenPBradshaw This already hasn‚Äôt aged well...
Replying to @BenPBradshaw and @DPJHodges My heart bleeds for that ridiculous campaign
Replying to @BenPBradshaw Rubbish the @LibDems have been fighting hard for a #PeoplesVote and evert time @UKLabour failed to support a #PeoplesVote
Politely disagree.

Make it clear that the first question was the what not the how and that this is part of the promised implementation process.

You make it clear that any blustering by Farage et al about it not being properly leaving is swiftly put down. Educate as to why. 

#MeasureTwiceCutOnce
Replying to @BenPBradshaw So Corbyn has decided to join them!
Replying to @BenPBradshaw And so is Labour apparently

Replying to @BenPBradshaw Our only hope for a PV now is for Labour to run an election campaign that is enthusiastically and positively pro-Europe. Labour has the strongest policies and most popular pledges - but if you try to campaign on this and fudge Brexit, the Tories will win.

Replying to @BenPBradshaw and @DPJHodges Disingenuous at best...

Before Labour (‚Äúofficial‚Äù) came to the 2nd Ref cause - they had already explicitly ruled it out to LibDems whilst banging on about needing an election instead.

You are party politicking as they are - so don‚Äôt play the ‚Äúselling out‚Äù card here...
If we were going to lose on the bill anyway, may as well get on board the GE bus in this instance...
